me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry

Class PointXYZ

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry.PointXY
      • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry.PointXYZ
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<PointXY>

    public class PointXYZ
extends PointXY
    A 2d coordinate with an X value, a Y value, and a value "Z" representing a heading angle.

    As an extension of the PointXY class, this class inherits many of the methods. Some of them are overridden to accommodate for the extra aspect (Z). Some of them aren't. You never know, right?

    Much like the aforementioned PointXY class, PointXYZs are immutable objects, meaning that after they're created, the values stored inside of them cannot be changed. Many of the methods here will return new PointXYZ objects instead of modifying an existing one.

    Since:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • zero

      • inDirection

        public static PointXYZ inDirection(PointXYZ base,
                                   double distance,
                                   Angle angle)
        Create a new PointXYZ a given distance away from a base point in a specified direction.

        As an example... if you have a point at (0, 0, 0) and were to do inDirection with a distance of 1 and an angle of 0 degrees, you'd get (1, 0, 0) as your output.

        Parameters:
        base - the base/origin point.
        distance - how far away the new point should be from the origin.
        angle - the angle at which the new point should be drawn.
        Returns:
        a new point, distance away from base in direction.

      • rotate

        public static PointXYZ rotate(PointXYZ point,
                              PointXY center,
                              Angle angle)
        Rotate a point around a center point.
        Parameters:
        point - the point to rotate.
        center - the center point (this is the point that point will be rotated around).
        angle - how far to rotate the point.
        Returns:
        a point, rotated around center by angle.

      • zeroIfNull

        public static PointXYZ zeroIfNull(PointXYZ point)
        If the provided point is null, return zero(). Otherwise, return the provided point. This method provides null safety.
        Parameters:
        point - the point.
        Returns:
        either the point, or zero().

      • inDirection

        public PointXYZ inDirection(double distance,
                            Angle angle)
        Create a new point a specified distance away from this point.

        As an example... if you have a point at (0, 0, 0) and were to do inDirection with a distance of 1 and an angle of 0 degrees, you'd get (1, 0, 0) as your output.

        Overrides:
        inDirection in class PointXY
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance the new point should be created at.
        angle - the angle the new point should be created at.
        Returns:
        a new point, distance away from this point, drawn at angle.
